One of the key features of Bootstrap is the ability to display toasts and notifications, which are small messages that appear on the screen to provide information or feedback to the user. This documentation will guide you through the process of using Bootstrap 5.3 toasts and notifications in your AngularJS application. ### Objective and Scope The objective of this documentation is to help you understand how to implement toasts and notifications using Bootstrap 5.3 in your AngularJS application. The scope of this documentation includes the necessary requirements, step-by-step instructions, code snippets, troubleshooting tips, and best practices for using Bootstrap toasts and notifications effectively. ### Requirements and Pre-requisites Before you can start using Bootstrap 5.3 toasts and notifications in your AngularJS application, you need to ensure that you have the following requirements and pre-requisites in place: 1. AngularJS installed in your project. 2. Bootstrap 5.3 CSS and JavaScript files included in your project. 3. Basic knowledge of HTML, CSS, and AngularJS. ### Step-by-Step Instructions Follow these step-by-step instructions to implement Bootstrap 5.3 toasts and notifications in your AngularJS application: 1. Create a controller in your AngularJS application to handle the toasts: ```javascript angular.module('myApp', []).controller('ToastController', function($scope) { $scope.toasts = []; $scope.showToast = function(title, message) { var toast = { title: title, message: message, time: new Date().toLocaleTimeString() }; $scope.toasts.push(toast); }; $scope.closeToast = function(index) { $scope.toasts.splice(index, 1); }; }); ``` 5. ``` 6.
